intro: Polymnia graveolens, commonly known as the stinking nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its dark green, oval-shaped leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or red when ripe. The plant is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is more pronounced in its flowers and fruits.
